parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>TRUE</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>TRUE. The post explicitly mentions "Pop Sebastian Tiberiu" as a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies for the PNCR party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>TRUE. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach.  The content is not a private message.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>TRUE. While the post focuses on civic education, it's presented within the context of an electoral campaign by a candidate. The hashtags (#ViitorulEAlTău, #TineriiVotează, #PutereaVotului, #PNCR) and the explicit mention of candidacy strongly suggest an electoral objective: to garner votes for the candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>FALSE. Although the post discusses civic education and uses examples from other European countries, its primary purpose is not journalistic reporting. The inclusion of the candidate's name, party affiliation, and campaign hashtags clearly shifts the focus towards electoral promotion.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>FALSE. The post presents a legislative initiative, but in the context of a political campaign.  It's not a personal opinion detached from electoral goals.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>544331185048380</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while superficially discussing civic education, functions as electoral propaganda.  The presence of a CMF number, explicit mention of candidacy, use of campaign hashtags, and the overall context of a paid political advertisement strongly indicate an intention to influence voters. The post leverages a seemingly neutral topic (civic education) to promote the candidate and their party.  While the information about civic education might be factually accurate, its presentation within this context clearly serves an electoral purpose. The argument that it's educational is weak because the educational content is secondary to the promotion of the candidate.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Pop Sebastian Tiberiu</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNCR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Entitatea responsabilă pentru postarea plătită, identificată prin ID-ul 544331185048380, încalcă articolul 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin difuzarea de propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024. Postarea, deși abordează superficial educația civică, promovează în mod evident candidatura lui Pop Sebastian Tiberiu pentru Camera Deputaților din partea PNCR, utilizând hashtag-uri de campanie (#ViitorulEAlTău, #TineriiVotează, #PutereaVotului, #PNCR) și menționând explicit calitatea de candidat.  Efectul electoral este clar, având în vedere obiectivul de a influența votul în favoarea candidatului.  Suma cheltuită pentru postare, conform Ad Library, se situează între 100 și 199 RON, iar numărul de impresii este estimat la 3.000-4.000, demonstrând intenția de a atinge un public larg.  Informațiile de contact ale advertiserului sunt disponibile: contact@sebastiantiberiupop.ro și +40760256257.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
